alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Jefferson; Lincoln (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 22 at 11:19AM CDT until March 22 at 1:10PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Arkansas County in southeastern Arkansas... Southeastern Jefferson County in southeastern Arkansas... Northeastern Lincoln County in southeastern Arkansas... * Until 110 PM CDT. * At 1119 AM CDT, Portions of Highways 11 and 343 were closed by ARDOT due to high water. The primary area of ongoing flooding is near Bayou Meto. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 inch in 2 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...The Arkansas Department of Transportation IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gould, Gillett, Grady, Almyra, Little Bayou Meto Park, Langford, De Witt, Douglas, Woodville, Richardson, Merrisach Lake, Whitefield, Linwood, Arkansas Post, Reydell, Lodge Corner, Bayou Meteo State Game Area, Sarassa, Almyra Airport and Varner. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
